intro: Hedyotis affinis, commonly known as the small white geranium, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to parts of Asia and Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many flowering plants known for their ornamental value. The plant typically grows to a height of about 10–30 centimeters, featuring small, white or pale pink flowers with five petals. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered with fine hairs. Hedyotis affinis is often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
